label: ABS
description: This function returns the absolute value of an expression.

label: ANYSERVICE
description: This function evaluates to Boolean TRUE if the particular service code exists on the specified record.

label: ANYWARNING
description: This function evaluates to Boolean TRUE if a particular warning code exists on the specified record

label: CAPITALIZE
description: This function translates the first character of each word to uppercase and translates all other alphabetic characters to lowercase

label: CHARACTERREAD
description: Displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the character string entered by the user

label: CHARACTERSEARCH
description: This function returns the position of the first occurrence of one character sequence within another character sequence.

label: CHRVALUE
description: This function returns the numeric decimal ASCII value of a single character.

label: CODEREAD
description: Displays the specified prompt on the operator's console, waits for a code response, and returns operator's response as the value of CODEREAD.

label: COL
description: This function specifies which column should contain output information.

label: COPYAPP
description: This function copies or moves fields from an Application record and its child records from one ID on an account to another ID on the same or different account. In addition, you can copy or move associated Credit Report record fields and their child records at the same time an Application is copied or moved

label: CREATEFINANCEFROMCREDREP
description: This function creates Finance records for a loan application based on trade items in a credit report.

label: CTRLCHR
description: This function lets you send non-printing control characters to a laser printer to take advantage of special features such as fonts, bold type, and boxes

label: DATASIZE
description: This function populates the data file report generated from a DATAFILE specfile.

label: DATE
description: This function converts a series of three numeric expressions into a single date value

label: DATEOFFSET
description: This function returns a date value by adjusting a starting date: either by a specified number of months, or to a specified day of the month.

label: DATEREAD
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the date entered.

label: DATEVALUE
description: This function converts dates stored as character data to the DATE data type.

label: DAY
description: This function returns the numerical value for the day in a date field or a date variable.

label: DAYOFWEEK
description: This function returns a numeric value from 0-6 representing the day of the week; 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday, etc.

label: DIALOGPROMPTCHAR
description: This function displays the text for a character data prompt in an interactive window.

label: DIALOGPROMPTCODE
description: This function displays the text for a code data prompt in an interactive window.

label: DIALOGPROMPTCOMBOOPTION
description: This function adds options to a drop-down list of choices in an interactive window.

label: DIALOGPROMPTCOMBOSTART
description: This function indicates the beginning of a drop-down list of options in an interactive window.

label: DIALOGPROMPTMONEY
description: This function displays a prompt for the user to enter a value.

label: DIALOGPROMPTNUMBER
description: This function displays a user prompt for a number.

label: DIALOGPROMPTPASSWORD
description: This function displays a prompt for the user to enter a password.

label: DIALOGPROMPTRATE
description: This function displays the text for a rate prompt in an interactive window.

label: DIALOGPROMPTYESNO
description: This function displays a drop-down list for a yes or no response in an interactive window.

label: DIALOGSTART
description: This function initiates a new prompt and response sequence in an interactive window.

label: DIALOGSTARTGROUPBOX
description: This function begins a group of prompts and responses in an interactive window.

label: DIALOGTEXTLISTOPTION
description: This function adds options as lines of data in a read-only list box contained in a pop-up window.

label: DIALOGTEXTLISTSTART
description: This function indicates the beginning of a list box of read-only data lines contained in a pop-up window.

label: DIM
description: This function returns the screen to normal display after characters are displayed with the BRIGHT command.

label: DIVPROJECTINIT
description: This function initializes the setup variables required for performing annual percentage yield (APY) calculations and dividend projections.

label: EMAILLINE
description: This function sends parameters or adds a line of text in an email message.

label: EMAILSEND
description: This function transmits an electronic message from within a specfile if your system is configured for email.

label: EMAILSTART
description: This function initiates an email message if your system is configured for email.

label: ENTERCHARACTER
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console while running an on-demand specfile and waiting for a character response from the operator.

label: ENTERCODE
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the code entered.

label: ENTERDATE
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the date entered.

label: ENTERMONEY
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the money value entered.

label: ENTERNUMBER
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the number entered.

label: ENTERRATE
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the rate entered.

label: ENTERYESNO
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns a Y (yes) or N (no) response.

label: EXECUTE
description: This function initiates the running of a subroutine specfile.

label: EXP
description: This function returns the value of the mathematical constant e raised to a specified power.

label: FILEARCHIVEADD
description: This function adds a file to an archive or creates an archive and adds a file to it.

label: FILEARCHIVEEXTRACT
description: This function retrieves a file from an archive.

label: FILECLOSE
description: This function closes file identified in the first argument.

label: FILECREATE
description: This function creates a new letter file, help file, PowerOn specfile, or edit file. Once the file is created, you must use the FILEOPEN function to access it.

label: FILEDECRYPT
description: This function decodes or deciphers files protected by encryption.

label: FILEGETPOS
description: This function retrieves the current byte position in the text file just read from or written to.

label: FILELISTCLOSE
description: This function closes a previously opened list of files.

label: FILELISTOPEN
description: This function opens a file list you want to read.

label: FILELISTREAD
description: This function reads lines in the list that are opened or created by FILELISTOPEN.

label: FILEOPEN
description: This function opens a file of the specified file type for processing in the selected open mode.

label: FILEREAD
description: This function reads an open file and saves the read data in a variable.

label: FILEREADLINE
description: This function reads a line of text from a file and then stores that line in the second argument.

label: FILESETPOS
description: This function sets the current byte position of the specified text file.

label: FILEWRITE
description: This function locates the given file number and writes the data you specify, beginning at the current byte position.

label: FILEWRITELINE
description: This function locates the file number specified and writes a line of text beginning at the current byte position.

label: FLOAT
description: This function converts a number, money, rate, date, or code value into its equivalent floating point value. It is intended for use on an entire numeric expression. It is useful for assigning a non-floating point value to a float variable. If you use this function on part of a compound expression, it can have unpredictable results.

label: FLOATVALUE
description: This function converts the characters that express a numeric value into a floating point numeric equivalent, and then places that value into a specified floating point variable.

label: FLOOR
description: This function returns the integer that is less than or equal to a given number, monetary amount, or floating point expression.

label: FORMAT
description: This function converts a numeric value to a predefined pattern of characters. It is used for printing or handling numeric data to control the formatting of digits, including the placement of commas and the suppression of leading zeros.

label: FTPCLOSE
description: This function closes an FTP session.

label: FTPCMD
description: This function sends a command directly to the FTP server and receives the response.

label: FTPGET
description: This function retrieves a file from the FTP server.

label: FTPLOGIN
description: This function logs a user into the FTP server.

label: FTPOPEN
description: This function opens a connection to a remote FTP server.

label: FTPPUT
description: This function moves a file to the FTP server.

label: FULLYEAR
description: This function returns a numerical value (from 1900-2078) equivalent to the four-digit year in a date expression.

label: GETDATACHAR
description: This function instructs PowerOn to retrieve the current value of an accessible character field in the Parameter or Console file. GETDATACHAR and GETDATACHARACTER are equivalent keywords.

label: GETDATADATE
description: This function retrieves the current value of an accessible date field in the Parameter or Console file.

label: GETDATAMONEY
description: This function retrieves the current value of an accessible monetary field in the Parameter or Console file.

label: GETDATANUMBER
description: This function retrieves the current value of an accessible number field in the Parameter or Console files.

label: GETDATARATE
description: This function retrieves the current value of an accessible rate field in the Parameter or Console file.

label: GETFIELDNUMBER
description: Takes a record number or integer expression and a field mnemonic or character expression, and returns the corresponding field number. Use this function to obtain the field number for a particular field. The field number is required for all the other GETFIELD functions. If any of the passed values are invalid, this function returns 0.

label: GETFIELDNAME
description: Takes a record number, field number, or integer expression; a field number or integer expression; and a subfield number or integer expression and then returns the corresponding character field name. Pass 0 for the subfield number if not required. If any of the passed values are invalid, this function returns a blank character value.

label: GETFIELDMNEMONIC
description: Takes a record number, field number, or integer expression; a field number or integer expression; and a subfield number or integer expression and then returns the corresponding character field mnemonic. Pass 0 for the subfield number if not required. If any of the passed values are invalid, this function returns a blank character value.

label: GETFIELDHELPFILE
description: Takes a record number or integer expression, field number or integer expression, and subfield number or integer expression and returns the corresponding numeric help file number. Pass 0 for the subfield number if not required. If any of the passed values are invalid, this function returns 0.

label: GETFIELDDATATYPE
description: Takes a record number or integer expression, field number or integer expression, and subfield number or integer expression and returns the corresponding numeric data type. Pass 0 for the subfield number if not required. If any of the passed values are invalid, this function returns 0.

label: GETFIELDDATAMAX
description: Takes a record number or integer expression, field number or integer expression, and subfield number or integer expression and returns the maximum value for the datatype

label: HEADER
description: This function defines a single line of column headings and their horizontal placement for PowerOn.

label: HEADERS
description: This function marks the beginning of a subsection of output and precedes print statements that create column headings for that subsection.

label: HOUR
description: This function returns the numerical value (from 00-23) equivalent to the hour stored in HHMM format.

label: HPBOXDRAW
description: This function commands a laser printer to draw a box between specified coordinates with an outline of a specified width and with shading of a specified amount.

label: HPESC
description: This function sends an escape sequence (a specific group of control characters that begins with the ESCAPE control character) to a laser printer.

label: HPFONT
description: This function changes the type font and point size on a laser printer.

label: HPLINEDRAW
description: This function commands a laser printer to draw a line of specified width between given coordinates.

label: HPLINESPERINCH
description: This function commands a laser printer to change the number of lines of text that can fit into a vertical inch of space on the page.

label: HPRESET
description: This function resets the printer page size (letter or legal) and print orientation (portrait or landscape) to the factory defaults for your laser printer.

label: HPSETUP
description: This function changes the printer page size (letter or legal) and print orientation (portrait or landscape).

label: HPUNDERLINE
description: This function controls the underline function of the laser printer.

label: HPXPOS
description: This function positions a laser printer at a specific horizontal axis coordinate.

label: HPYPOS
description: This function positions a laser printer at a specific vertical axis coordinate.

label: HTMLVIEWDISPLAY
description: This function displays information in a view window using HTML commands.

label: HTMLVIEWLINE
description: This function allows you to enter a line of HTML code to create information in a view window.

label: HTMLVIEWOPEN
description: This function opens an HTML view window.

label: INITCREDITREPORT
description: This function initializes the Credit Retrieval System setup variables that are required for pulling reports from Equifax, Experian, TransUnion, and the ChexSystems suite.

label: INITSUBROUTINE
description: This function initializes the variables that you can use to pass information to a PowerOn subroutine specfile.

label: INT
description: This function returns the integer part of a given number, monetary amount, or floating point expression.

label: LENGTH
description: This function returns the number of characters in a character string.

label: LOANPROJECTINIT
description: This function initializes the special setup variables required to perform loan projection calculations.

label: LOG
description: This function returns the natural logarithm of a specified number, code, or floating point value.

label: LOWERCASE
description: This function converts the alphabetic characters of a character expression to lowercase letters.

label: MD5HASH
description: This function is used with the PASSWORDHASH function to encrypt audio access codes and home banking passwords.

label: MINUTE
description: This function returns the minute value (from 0 to 59) of a time expression stored in HHMM format.

label: MOD
description: This function returns the remainder after dividing one number by another.

label: MONEY
description: This function converts a number, code, float, or rate value into a monetary value that can be assigned to a variable type number or can be printed. It is intended for use on an entire numeric expression. If you use it on part of a compound expression, it can have unpredictable results.

label: MONEYREAD
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the money response.

label: MONTH
description: This function returns a numeric value from 01 through 12 (January through December).

label: NUMBER
description: This function converts a monetary, code, float, date, or rate value into a number value that can be assigned to a variable type number or can be printed. It is intended for use on an entire numeric expression. If you use this function on part of a compound expression, it can have unpredictable results.

label: NUMBERREAD
description: This function displays a prompt on the user's console and returns the number response.

label: OUTPUTCLOSE
description: This function closes any additional output destinations you have opened.

label: OUTPUTOPEN
description: This function opens the specified output destination, and then all subsequent output is sent to that destination.

label: OUTPUTSWITCH
description: This function changes all subsequent output to a different output destination.

label: PASSWORDHASH
description: This function encrypts access codes and home banking passwords.

label: POPUPMESSAGE
description: This function produces a message window over the current display. These windows allow you to display information at any time. You then click the accompanying OK button to proceed.

label: PRINT
description: This function, used for displaying information, uses the next available column to print the value of a particular expression.

label: PULLCREDITREPORT
description: This function queues custom requests to pull credit reports from a credit bureau, updates the value of the @CREDITREPORTERROR field with the result, and pulls identity verification information when used with ChexSystems.

label: PWR
description: This function returns the float value of raising one numeric value to the power of a second numeric value.
